sub_title: In search of new exciting chapter - Training✦Hotel Pre-Opening✦Process Improvement✦Branding✦ILT&vILT✦MBTI✦EQ 2.0✦Foodie
summary:
I am passionate about developing others and seeing them grow to their potential. I enjoy bringing out the best in people through formal and informal interactive programs. ‘Light-bulb’ moments fuel me with energy and drive to continue to explore human relationships. 

My latest role's areas of responsibilities are: 
•Delivered Training Courses within EAME division
•Performed new EAME L&D Program’s TNA, Design, Development, Implementation, & Evaluation Plan
•Collaborated with L&D Stakeholders (inter and intra-disciplines) for a successful divisional roll out  
•Managed vILT delivery 
•Delivered the training curriculum for our 30+ New Built and Transition Hotels. 

My recent career highlights are:
•Introduced new training modality (Virtual Classroom) into the division; 4 new programs
•Developed, piloted, and launched two programs for our HR community
•Collaborated with the global L&D team to design, develop, and implement ILT to vILT translation projects. 
•Together with the L&D Team, rolled out the Service Culture Programs impacting 270+ hotels and over 45,000 associates. 

I am enthusiastic, innovative, energetic, humble, and collaborative. I am also people-focused, relationship-based motivator and effective communicator. 

I value continuous learning, team work, self-realization/fulfilment, and work-life balance.

I am in search of a new exciting career chapter which I could use my acquired L&D skills and operational background in the hospitality industry. The ideal role could encompass (not limited to) consultancy, program design, training delivery and evaluation. I operate at my best in an organization that value both technical and relationship skills. 

My areas of expertise: Myers-Briggs Type Indicator, Emotional Intelligence 2.0, Coaching, Leadership Training, Organisational skills, Collaboration, Green Belt – Six Sigma, Lean Operation & Improvement, Training & Development, Virtual Classroom Design, Adobe Connect, HR Recruitment & Assessment Center.

school.name: University of Massachusetts at Amherst - Isenberg School of Management
DCT - International Hotel & Business Management School

profile_positions.description:
Together with the divisional L&D Team, I am responsible to implement, deliver and evaluate all Starwood Global Programs ranging from Leadership Program to our hotel leaders to foundational Service Culture Program to our hotel associates. Additionally, I support the divisional Training Delivery by conducting the training curriculum for our New Built and Transition hotels as well as delivering divisional functional academies. 

Key Highlights:
-One of the two divisional Emotional Intelligence Certified Facilitators & Coaches
-One of the three divisional Myers-Briggs Type Indicator Facilitators & Coaches
-Divisional Virtual Classroom Champion
-Point of Contact for all L&D Queries of Training Managers (approximately of 270+ Hotels)
profile_positions.title: Manager, Learning & Development, EAME

profile_positions.description:
While focusing in Learning & Development of the hotel, I also take on HR responsibilities such as recruitments of front-line to manager level; payroll analysis & budget together with our Director of Human Resources; and heavily involved in other areas of general HR such as corporate social responsibility and associate relations & well-being.

Key Highlights:
-	Achieved ‘Beyond Expectation’ on performance rating in 2012 & 2013
-	Managed and mentored 2 Vita Futura Graduate Management Trainees
-	Facilitated the TtT program for EAME Division as an Ad Hoc Task Force Trainer
-	Localized and delivered all the Associate and Manager Service Culture Training
-	Project lead the Execution of the Sheraton Week 
-	Developed and delivered Sheraton Skyline Leadership Enrichment Program
profile_positions.title: Learning & Development Manager

profile_positions.description:
Assisting in rolling out the new Service Culture Train-the-Trainer Program to the Sheraton/Westin Service Culture Champions within EAME. By the end of the 3 months taskforce, I co-facilitated 6 out of 9 HUB sessions. Additionally, in November I rolled out the Service Culture Programme to the Heads of Departments of the newly opened Sheraton Moscow Airport as a Master Champion.

My contributions during the task force:
-	Created communication and related materials for pre-during-post session
-	Liaised with Hotel Teams for training requirements (Brand Activation Activities)
-	Facilitated, delivered, and debriefed the Modules (both eLearning & classroom)
-	Maximised the participants’ learning potential by creating and implementing creative activities such as ‘Walking the Pathway’ and ‘Stakeholder Analysis’
-	To be the point of contact for any support and post-session questions
profile_positions.title: Task Force Training Manager

profile_positions.description:
Responsible of recruitment, training, associate well-being, corporate social responsibility, associate social events, HR administration, and internship/work experience management. 

Highlights:
-	Achieved ‘Exceed Expectation’ on performance rating in 2011
-	Contributed to the increase of 1% 2011 v. 2010 to the Associate Satisfaction Survey for Supervisory Effectiveness. 
-	Developed a Best Practice Refresher Training program for Sheraton Brand Activation based on the operational key metric analysis ~ mystery shopper
profile_positions.title: HR and Learning & Development Executive

profile_positions.description:
Fully managed accounts in both Group and Transient Corporate segment. My role ranged from account prospecting, qualifying, contracting, and account maintenance. 

Highlights:
-	Proposed and developed ‘the First Time Stayer’ Program for the hotel to recognize and build emotional connection with our corporate guests at the first instance they experience our hotel.
-	Streamlined the Request for Proposal Process with adopting ‘Bid Sheet’ form which contains all the crucial information and checklist for each steps of the process.
profile_positions.title: Account (Sales) Executive

profile_positions.description:
18-month Graduate Management Program of Choice within the industry. Selected to be one of 21 future leaders out of 1000+ applications in 2007.

Program Highlights:
1st Stage (Operational Overview):
-	Various Operational Departments such as Rooms, Food & Beverage and etc.
-	Six-week coverage as the Executive Assistant to the Senior Vice President, Director of Operations for Western Europe and to the Area General Manager of England 
2nd Stage (In-Depth Experience):
-	Events
-	Revenue Management 
3rd Stage (Specialization):
-	Sales: Worked as a Sales Coordinator for four Central London Hotels.


Common misspellings of my name are: Jo Gani, Joe Gandhi, Jo Gandhi, Joe Ganni, Ganny.
profile_positions.title: Vita Futura Graduate Management Trainee
